Dialogue.Page: Alright! Looks like this chunk of Brittle Hollow is as stable as it gets.
Like I'd have found that out if I'd just used the scout's integrity reading like Hornfels always nags about..
All the chunks read 100% integrity! It's how much that 100% decreases if you stomp too hard or whatever that matters!
But uh, hm, wow. Brittle Hollow.. seriously lives up to that first part of its name.
You're telling me just a light crash into a piece of its crust... with one of Slate's rickety ships... damages the crust that much? ..That's just horrifying.
I probably shouldn't keep trying to test surface integrity by crashing my ship into it then...
Repairs aside, might not be much of a planet left by the time I'm done.
Anyway... What are these weird lil' crystals? They're making me stick to the wall.
Guess they must play with gravity somehow? That's neat.
I should try bring one home to Timber Hearth. Bet it'd make a pretty neat exhibit in Hornfels' new museum!
If Slate could install one in the ship, maybe it'd do something getting spacesick driving that rickety ship, too.
And if the ship has some localized gravity, maybe I can finally fly that lil' hatchling who's afraid of space to see the ruins on this planet at last!
